posts.post_content:
Devastating card. The fact that you're required to sacrifice your own land if you're the only player with that kind, however, means it doesn't play nice with my sunburst deck. I guess I could try shooting for all non-basic lands...  
  
Still, 5/5.

posts.post_content: Go ahead, just *try* plopping this guy on the table next to [Venser, the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, the Sojourner) or [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter) in a large multiplayer game. Then instead of playing "get your opponents to 0 life," you're suddenly participating in an engaging game of "how much can I slow this game down before my friends murder me?"

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (8/19/2012 2:38:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @kragash: Sure, unless you flicker him or mimic vat him or whatever. Then you get to stomp all over your opponents' mana base. That might not be *broken* but land destruction is definitely unfun to play against, especially repeatable LD. Especially in multiplayer - in a duel you're likely to have to kill some of your own lands unless your opponent runs a five-color deck, but in multiplayer there's a far better chance that your opponents have all five colors between them.
posts.html:
@kragash: Sure, unless you flicker him or mimic vat him or whatever. Then you get to stomp all over your opponents' mana base. That might not be broken but land destruction is definitely unfun to play against, especially repeatable LD. Especially in multiplayer - in a duel you're likely to have to kill some of your own lands unless your opponent runs a five-color deck, but in multiplayer there's a far better chance that your opponents have all five colors between them.
